_header: Ye holy priests remembreth in your heart
Note: In MSS 1 and 2 this piece follows 6820 without break.
_description: John Lydgate, ‘An exortacion to Prestys’ — six 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc), including envoy

OxfBal354.First Lines:
Ye holy prestes remembryth in your hartToward masse when ye do you
                    dresseWith love & dred first mekely doth adverteThe
                    vertues dygnyte the noblesse…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…Mekely compyled vnder direccounDyrecte of hart both to more
                    & lasseOf humble will & no presumpcounTo folke desposid euery
                    day to say there masse
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile
                    of Oxford, Balliol MS 354.
         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).

CamGon174.First Lines:
Ye holy prystis remember in youre hertTowarde masse when ȝe do
                    you dresse…
CamGon174.Last Lines:
…Of humble wyll & no presumpcionTo prestis dysposyd ech
                    day to syng þer masse
CamGon174.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 84-6 (Envoy only).

CamTCC601.First Lines:
yE holy prestes remembreth in your herte Toward masse when ye do
                    yow dresse With loue and drede furst mekely doth aduerte The dignite
                    of vertuous noblesse…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…lat hym nat out of youre mynde pas Repast of Aungelles in the
                    heuynly mansyon
CamTCC601.Attributed Author:
by John Lydgate (added by later hand, f. 205); Lydgate (added by later
                    hand, f. 205v)
CamTCC601.Attributed Title:
An exortacion to Prestys when they shall sey theyre Masse (f. 205, by
                    scribe)
CamTCC601.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 84-6.
